item.title: -----Help----STARTING LEVELS----HELP----
item.dc:creator: @KingKj52 KingKj52
item.description:
@KingKj52 wrote:

Go into your item.cfg and search for magic_long.

Find the one you want to change, and there will be alot of numbers to the right, each set seperated by tabs.

The third set is alch gold, change it to what you want. Save.

Read full topic

item.title: -----Help----STARTING LEVELS----HELP----
item.dc:creator: @Elven_Dremor Elven Dremor
item.description:
@Elven_Dremor wrote:

Ok powned, ill tell you a way to make your mage require level 1 mage to high alch.

first search [QUOTE]alch[/QUOTE]

Next you should see [QUOTE] if (command.startsWith(“alch”) && playerRights >= -1) {
addItem(1387, 1);
addItem(561, 1000);
addItem(860, 1000);
}[/QUOTE]
If it’s set up like that then your fine since -1 is for normal players for deltascape’s source.

Next,Search [QUOTE]alch[/QUOTE] a couple more times till you get this [QUOTE]if(castSpell == 1178) //High Alch with staffs and Fire runes (BY soul)
{
if(playerLevel[6] >= 1)
{
if((HasItemAmount(561, 1)==false) || (HasItemAmount(554, 5)==false) && playerEquipment[playerWeapon] != 1387 || (playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 1387) && (HasItemAmount(561, 1)==false))
{
sM(“You do not have enough runes to cast this spell.”);
}
if((HasItemAmount(561, 1)==true) && (HasItemAmount(554, 5)==true) || (playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 1387) && (HasItemAmount(561, 1)==true))
{
if(castOnItem == 995)
{
sM(“You can’t cast high alchemy on gold.”);
} else {
if(castOnItem == 1)
{
sM(“You cant convert this item.”);
} else if (System.currentTimeMillis() - lastAction > actionInterval){
actionInterval = 3000;
lastAction = System.currentTimeMillis();
setAnimation(713);
specGFX(113);
addSkillXP(2000, 6);
alchvaluez = (alchvaluez / 3);
deleteItem(castOnItem, castOnSlot, 1);
addItem(995, alchvaluez);
sendFrame106(6);
deleteItem(561, getItemSlot(561), 1);//Remove nature rune
if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] != 1387){
deleteItem(554, getItemSlot(554), 1); //Remove fire rune
}
}
}
}
}
else if(playerLevel[6] <= 1)
{
sM(“You need a magic level of 55 to cast this spell.”);
}
}
break;[/QUOTE]

Next change [QUOTE]if(playerLevel[6] >= 55)[/QUOTE]
Replace the 55 with a one.

if(playerLevel[6] >= 1)

Next look for[QUOTE]else if(playerLevel[6] <= 55)
{
sM(“You need a magic level of 55 to cast this spell.”);[/QUOTE]

Change [QUOTE]else if(playerLevel[6] <= 55)[/QUOTE]
Make it look like this [QUOTE]else if(playerLevel[6] <= 1)[/QUOTE]

That’s it, and if you wanna change xp you look for. [QUOTE]addSkillXP(2000, 6);[/QUOTE]
Replace the 2000 with what you want to give per alch.

Enjoy

Read full topic

item.title: -----Help----STARTING LEVELS----HELP----
item.dc:creator: @Destroyed_32 Destroyed 32
item.description:
@Destroyed_32 wrote:

Add this to your player.java:

for (int s = 0; s < playerLevel.length; s++) { // Setting Mage Level if (s == 6) { playerLevel[s] = 56; playerXP[s] = 85000; } else { playerLevel[s] = 1; playerXP[s] = 0; } }

Than the starters have Mage lvl 55

Mfg, Dest

Read full topic

currently i found this

KilledBy[j1] = 0;
}

	for (int i = 0; i < playerLevel.length; i++) {

		if (i == 3) {
			playerLevel[i] = 10;
			playerXP[i] = 1155;
			currentHealth = 10;
			maxHealth = 10;
		} else {

can someone please help me!?
